body:
Comment 1: 
There is a difference between order of evaluation and precedence.

a - b - c

is required to parse as (a - b) - c not a - (b - c) because the
precedence is "left to right".  That says nothing about when
a, b, and c are evaluated, just the order in which they are 
combined.

The order of evaluation section in the spec says that function
calls happen left to right, no matter what.  f(5) gets called
first, then f(6), then f(3), then f(2), then f(1).

Which is what is happening.  It's correct.
_Owner changed to **r...@golang.org**._ _Status changed to **WontFix**._
